text:
[Rakshasa women lament over the death of Rakshasas in war.]

तानितानिसहस्राणिसारोहाणां च वाजिनाम् ।

रथानांत्वग्निवर्णानांसध्वजानांसहस्रशः ।।6.95.1।।

राक्षसानांसहस्राणिगदापरिघयोधिनाम् ।

काञ्चनध्वजचित्राणांशूराणांकामरूपिणाम् ।।6.95.2।।

निहतानिशरैर्दीस्तीक्ष्णैस्तप्तकाञ्चनभूषणैः ।

रावणेनप्रयुक्तानिरामेणाक्लिष्टकर्मणा ।।6.95.3।।
meaning: रावणेन by Ravana, प्रयुक्तानि yoked, सारोहाणि mounted, तानि them, तानिसहस्राणि thousands of them, वाजिनाम् horses, अग्निवर्णानम् of the colour of fire, सध्वजानाम् warriors, सहस्रशः thousands, रथानाम् chariots, गतापरिघयोधिनाम् who wage war with iron bars, काञ्चनध्वजचित्राणाम् wonderful with gold colour pictures on chariot tops, शूराणाम् arrows, कामरूपिणाम् who can change form at their will, शूराणाम् warriors, कामरूपिणाम् who can change their form at will, राक्षसानाम् Rakshasas, सहस्राणि thousands, अक्लिष्टकर्मणाम्one who will not get tired of work, रामेण of Rama, दीप्तै: glowing, तीक्ष्णै sharp:, काञ्चनभूषणैः decked with gold, शरैः arrows, हतानि put an end
translation: "Rama who can work without getting tired put an end to thousands of Rakshasa warriors with his sharp glowing arrows decked with gold. Thousands of warriors sent by king Ravana, mounted on chariots, yoked to horses, of the colour of fire, thousands of warriors who could wage with iron bars, decked in gold, mounted on colourful chariots of golden colour pictures and Rakshasas who can change their form at will, were destroyed by Sri Rama."

text:
[Rakshasa women lament over the death of Rakshasas in war.]

तानितानिसहस्राणिसारोहाणां च वाजिनाम् ।

रथानांत्वग्निवर्णानांसध्वजानांसहस्रशः ।।6.95.1।।

राक्षसानांसहस्राणिगदापरिघयोधिनाम् ।

काञ्चनध्वजचित्राणांशूराणांकामरूपिणाम् ।।6.95.2।।

निहतानिशरैर्दीस्तीक्ष्णैस्तप्तकाञ्चनभूषणैः ।

रावणेनप्रयुक्तानिरामेणाक्लिष्टकर्मणा ।।6.95.3।।
meaning: रावणेन by Ravana, प्रयुक्तानि yoked, सारोहाणि mounted, तानि them, तानिसहस्राणि thousands of them, वाजिनाम् horses, अग्निवर्णानम् of the colour of fire, सध्वजानाम् warriors, सहस्रशः thousands, रथानाम् chariots, गतापरिघयोधिनाम् who wage war with iron bars, काञ्चनध्वजचित्राणाम् wonderful with gold colour pictures on chariot tops, शूराणाम् arrows, कामरूपिणाम् who can change form at their will, शूराणाम् warriors, कामरूपिणाम् who can change their form at will, राक्षसानाम् Rakshasas, सहस्राणि thousands, अक्लिष्टकर्मणाम्one who will not get tired of work, रामेण of Rama, दीप्तै: glowing, तीक्ष्णै sharp:, काञ्चनभूषणैः decked with gold, शरैः arrows, हतानि put an end
translation: "Rama who can work without getting tired put an end to thousands of Rakshasa warriors with his sharp glowing arrows decked with gold. Thousands of warriors sent by king Ravana, mounted on chariots, yoked to horses, of the colour of fire, thousands of warriors who could wage with iron bars, decked in gold, mounted on colourful chariots of golden colour pictures and Rakshasas who can change their form at will, were destroyed by Sri Rama."

text:
[Rakshasa women lament over the death of Rakshasas in war.]

तानितानिसहस्राणिसारोहाणां च वाजिनाम् ।

रथानांत्वग्निवर्णानांसध्वजानांसहस्रशः ।।6.95.1।।

राक्षसानांसहस्राणिगदापरिघयोधिनाम् ।

काञ्चनध्वजचित्राणांशूराणांकामरूपिणाम् ।।6.95.2।।

निहतानिशरैर्दीस्तीक्ष्णैस्तप्तकाञ्चनभूषणैः ।

रावणेनप्रयुक्तानिरामेणाक्लिष्टकर्मणा ।।6.95.3।।
meaning: रावणेन by Ravana, प्रयुक्तानि yoked, सारोहाणि mounted, तानि them, तानिसहस्राणि thousands of them, वाजिनाम् horses, अग्निवर्णानम् of the colour of fire, सध्वजानाम् warriors, सहस्रशः thousands, रथानाम् chariots, गतापरिघयोधिनाम् who wage war with iron bars, काञ्चनध्वजचित्राणाम् wonderful with gold colour pictures on chariot tops, शूराणाम् arrows, कामरूपिणाम् who can change form at their will, शूराणाम् warriors, कामरूपिणाम् who can change their form at will, राक्षसानाम् Rakshasas, सहस्राणि thousands, अक्लिष्टकर्मणाम्one who will not get tired of work, रामेण of Rama, दीप्तै: glowing, तीक्ष्णै sharp:, काञ्चनभूषणैः decked with gold, शरैः arrows, हतानि put an end
translation: "Rama who can work without getting tired put an end to thousands of Rakshasa warriors with his sharp glowing arrows decked with gold. Thousands of warriors sent by king Ravana, mounted on chariots, yoked to horses, of the colour of fire, thousands of warriors who could wage with iron bars, decked in gold, mounted on colourful chariots of golden colour pictures and Rakshasas who can change their form at will, were destroyed by Sri Rama."

meaning: हतशेषाः left over, निशाचराः night rangers, दृष्टवा seeing, श्रुत्वा hearing, सम्भ्रानातः bewildered, दीनाः piteous, चिन्तापरिप्लुताः filled with agony, राक्षसीः Rakshasas, समागम्य coming together, पर्यदेवयन् moving in groups, विधवाः widowed, हतपुत्राश्च son killed, हतबान्धवाः च kin killed, राक्षस्यः protectors, सहसङ्गम्य all associates, दुःखार्ताः stricken in grief
translation: "On seeing and hearing of the others left over, the night rangers felt bewildered and piteous with agony coming together, moving in groups, those who lost husband, son, kin and protectors along with associates crying, stricken with grief."

meaning: हतशेषाः left over, निशाचराः night rangers, दृष्टवा seeing, श्रुत्वा hearing, सम्भ्रानातः bewildered, दीनाः piteous, चिन्तापरिप्लुताः filled with agony, राक्षसीः Rakshasas, समागम्य coming together, पर्यदेवयन् moving in groups, विधवाः widowed, हतपुत्राश्च son killed, हतबान्धवाः च kin killed, राक्षस्यः protectors, सहसङ्गम्य all associates, दुःखार्ताः stricken in grief
translation: "On seeing and hearing of the others left over, the night rangers felt bewildered and piteous with agony coming together, moving in groups, those who lost husband, son, kin and protectors along with associates crying, stricken with grief."

meaning: वृद्धा aged, कराला dreadful, निर्णतोदरी hideous, शूर्पणखा Surpanakha, कन्दर्पमिवरूपिणम् of like god of love, रामम् Rama, वने in the forest, कथम् how, आससाद approach
translation: "How did that old, dreadful and hideous Surpanakha approach Rama, whose form is charming like the god of love, in the forest?"

meaning: लोकनिन्द्या deserves to be killed, हीनरूपा of ugly appearance, सा she, सुकुमारम् delicate, महासत्त्वम् extraordinary goodness, सर्वभूतहिते wellwisher of all beings, रतम् always, तम् him, दृष्टवा seeing, प्रकामिता stung with love
translation: "That woman of ugly appearance deserves to be killed. How is it that she was stung with love with that delicate Rama, a well wisher of all beings?"

meaning: सर्वगुणैः virtuous, हीना ugly, दुर्मुखी terrific appearance, राक्षसी rakshasi, गुणवन्तम् virtuous, सुमुखम् in favour, रामम् Rama, कथम् how, कामयामास dare to love
translation: "How did that rakshasi of terrible appearance dare to love that virtuous Rama?"

meaning: वलिनी old and wrinkled, श्वेतमूर्धजा grey haired, अप्रतिरूपा uncouth appearance, अस्यजनस्य her own people, अल्पभाग्यत्वात् because of bad luck, राक्षसानाम् Rakshasas, दूषणस्य Dooshana's, खरस्य च Khara's, विनाशाय destruction, अकार्यम् misdeed, अपहास्यम् ridiculing, सर्वलोकविगर्हितम् condemned by the whole world, राघवस्य Raghava's, प्रधर्षणम् attacking, चकार tried
translation: "Because of our bad luck and to the destruction of her own people, Khara and Dooshana, that old lady, with wrinkled face, grey haired (Surpanakha) Rakshasa woman tried to go and attack Raghava, a misdeed which was ridiculed and condemned by the whole world?"

meaning: वलिनी old and wrinkled, श्वेतमूर्धजा grey haired, अप्रतिरूपा uncouth appearance, अस्यजनस्य her own people, अल्पभाग्यत्वात् because of bad luck, राक्षसानाम् Rakshasas, दूषणस्य Dooshana's, खरस्य च Khara's, विनाशाय destruction, अकार्यम् misdeed, अपहास्यम् ridiculing, सर्वलोकविगर्हितम् condemned by the whole world, राघवस्य Raghava's, प्रधर्षणम् attacking, चकार tried
translation: "Because of our bad luck and to the destruction of her own people, Khara and Dooshana, that old lady, with wrinkled face, grey haired (Surpanakha) Rakshasa woman tried to go and attack Raghava, a misdeed which was ridiculed and condemned by the whole world?"

meaning: तन्निमित्तम् for that reason, रावणेन by Ravana, महत् great, इदंवैरम् this enmity, कृतम् conceived, रक्षसा Rakshasa, दशग्रीवे ten headed, सासीता that Sita, वधाय borne away
translation: "For that reason of Surpanakha, this enmity has been conceived by Ravana and Sita was borne away by the ten headed Rakshasa."

meaning: दशग्रीवः tenheaded, जनकात्मजाम् janaka'sdaughter, सीताम् Sita, न च प्राप्नोति leading to, बलवता forcibly, राघवेण by Raghava, अक्षयम् undying, वैरम् enmity, बद्धम् contracted
translation: "Hope the ten headed Ravana will not touch Sita forcibly, by which undying enmity has been contracted already."

meaning: वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, प्रार्धयानम् solicitous, एकेन one, रामेण by Rama, हतम् killed, राक्षसम् Rakshasa, विराधम् Viradha, प्रेक्षय perceiving, तत् that, निदर्शनम् proof, पर्याप्तम् sufficient
translation: "On perceiving that Viradha solicitous of Vaidehi, the Rakshasa was killed by Rama with one arrow. That is sufficient proof (of Rama's valour)."

meaning: जनस्थाने at Janasthana, भीमकर्मणाम् of dreadful deeds, रक्षसाम् Rakshasas, चतुर्दश fourteen, सहस्राणि thousand, अग्निशिखोपमैः like peaks of fire, शरैः arrow, निहतानि destroyed
translation: " At Janasthana fourteen thousand Rakshasas have been destroyed with his arrows like peaks of fire."

meaning: सङ्ख्ये in combat, आदित्यसङ्काशैःsun like, शरैः arrows, खरश्च Khara, निहतः killed, दूषणः Dooshana, तथा so also, त्रिशिराः Trisira, तत् that, पर्याप्तम् example, निदर्शनम् sufficient proof
translation: "Khara was killed in that combat with sunlike arrows, so also Dooshana and Trisira. That example is sufficient proof."

meaning: अथ and now, क्रोधात् enraged, नादंनदन् came roaring, योजनबाहुः with eight meters long arms, रुधिराशनः who lived on blood, सः he, कबन्धः Kabhanda, हतः killed, तत् that, पर्याप्तम् sufficient, निदर्शनम् example
translation: "Kabhanda who lived on blood came roaring, enraged, whose arms were eight meters long was also killed and that is a sufficient example."

meaning: रामः Rama, बलिनम्mighty, सहस्रनयनात्मजम् son of thousand eyed Indra, मेरुसङ्काशम् resembled mountain Meru, वालिनम् Vali, जघान killed, तत् that, पर्याप्तम् sufficient, निदर्शनम् example
translation: "Mighty Rama killed the son of thousand eyed Indra, Vali, who resembled mountain Meru. That example is sufficient proof."

meaning: ऋष्यमूके Rishyamukha, वसन् living, दीनःdejected, भग्नमनोरथः disconsolate, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, राज्यम् kingdom, प्रापितः restored, तत् his, पर्याप्तम् sufficient, निदर्शनम् example
translation: "Sugriva, who was living on Rishyamukha, dejected and disconsolate was restored with his kingdom. That is sufficient."

meaning: धर्मार्थसहितम् in accordance with righteousness, सर्वेषाम् all, रक्षसाम् Rakshasa, हितम् good, युक्तम् appropriate, विभीषणेन by Vibheeshana, उक्तम् spoken, वाक्यम् words, मोहात् in delusion, तस्य his, न रोचते not like d
translation: "Good advice given by Vibheeshana in accordance with righteousness was not liked by him in delusion."

meaning: धनदानुजः younger brother of Kubera, विभीषणवचः Vibheeshana's words, कुर्यात् स्मयदि had followed, इयम् this, लङ्का Lanka, श्मशानभूता crematorium, दुःखार्ता stricken with grief, न भविष्यति would not have become
translation: "Had Ravana, the younger brother of Kubera followed the advice of Vibheeshana, this Lanka would not have been stricken with grief and turned into a crematorium."

meaning: तदा then, महाबलम् endowed with extraordinary strength, कुम्भकर्णम् Kumbhakarna, राघवेण by Raghava, हतम् killed, श्रुत्वा hearing, दुर्मर्षम् difficult to disregard, अतिकायम् Atikaya, प्रियंपुत्रम् dear son, इन्द्रजितम् Indrajith also, लक्ष्मणेन by Lakshmana, हतम् killed, रावणः Ravana, नावबुध्यते not realised.
translation: "Kumbhakarna of extraordinary strength having been killed by Raghava, and even on hearing that Atikaya who is difficult to disregard, and Indrajith, dear son killed by Lakshmana also, Ravana has not realised."

meaning: मम my, पुत्रः son, रणे in combat, हतः killed, मम my, भ्राता brother, मम my, भर्ता husband, इति thus, एषः those, राक्षसीनाम् Rakshasa women, शब्धः sound, कुलेकुले in every family, श्रूयते was heard
translation: "My son is killed, my brother is killed, my husband is killed," was the sound heard from every family.

meaning: शूरेणwarriors, रामेण by Rama, रणे in war, रथाश्च chariots also, अश्वाश्च horses also, नागाश्च elephants, शतसहस्रशः hundreds and thousands, हताः killed, पदातयाश्चापि even foot soldiers, हताःkilled
translation: "Horses, elephants, warriors, even foot soldiers were killed, chariots were destroyed, and hundreds and thousands struck down in war by Rama."

meaning: रुद्रोवा by Rudra, यदिवा is it, विष्णुः Lord Vishnu, शतक्रतुः who has done a hundred sacrifices, महेन्द्रोवा by Mahendra, यदिवा is it, स्वयम् himself, अन्तकः god of death, रामरूपेण in the form of Rama, नः is it, हन्ति killing
translation: "Is it Rudra, or Lord Vishnu, or Indra, who has done hundred sacrifices in the past or is it that the god of death itself has taken the form of Rama and killed him?"

meaning: रामेण by Rama, हतप्रवीराः eminent heroes, वयम् we, जीविते life, निराशाः lost, भयस्य with fear, अन्तम् end, अपश्यन्तः not able to see, अनाथाः orphans, विलपामहे weeping
translation: "Eminent heroes killed by Rama, hopes of life lost, not able to see the end of fear, we are like orphans weeping."

meaning: शूरः arrows, दत्तमहावरः graced with boon, दशग्रीवः tenheaded, रामहस्तात् from the hand s of Rama, समुत्पन्नम् that appalling danger, इदम् this way, महाघोरम् most dreadful, भयम् fear, न बुध्यते not realised
translation: "Graced with the boon of arrows the tenheaded Ravana has not realised the appalling danger to him from Rama."

text:
तं न देवा न गन्धर्वा न पिशाचा न राक्षसाः ।।6.95.27।।

उपसृष्टंपरित्रातुंशक्तारामेणसम्युगे ।
meaning: रामेण by Rama, सम्युगे in war, उपसृष्टम् attacked तम् him, त्रातुम् to protect, देवाः gods, न शक्ताः not possible, गन्धर्वाः Gandharvas, न not, पिशाचाः fiends, न not, राक्षसाः Rakshasas, न not
translation: "Neither gods nor Gandharvas, not even fiends will be able to protect, struck by Rama in war."

meaning: रावणस्य Ravana's, रणेरणे in every war, उत्पाताश्चापि are rising up, दृश्यन्ते seen, रामेण by Rama, रावणस्य Ravana's, निबर्हणम् destroying, कथयन्ति हि how much more to say
translation: "In every war evil portents are noticed rising up, of Rama destroying Ravana. How much more to say?"

meaning: प्रीतेन lovingly, पितामहेन by Brahma, रावणस्य Ravana's, देवदानवराक्षसैः Devas Danavas and Rakshasas, अभयम् protection, दत्तम् provided, मनुष्येभ्यःfrom humans, न याचितम् not sought
translation: "Brahma has lovingly provided protection to Ravana from Devas, Danavas and Rakshasas. He did not seek protection from humans."

meaning: रक्षसाम् Rakshasas, रावणस्य च Ravana's, जीवितान्तकरम् fearlessness of death, घोरम् terrific, मानुषम् human beings, तत् that, इदम् this way, भयम् fear, प्राप्तम् attained, मन्ये think, निःसंशयम् no doubt
translation: "Fearlessness of death from human beings attained by Ravana in this way was no doubt terrific to Rakshasas and Ravana."

meaning: वरदानेन by the boon, बलिना mighty, रक्षसा Rakshasa, पीड्यमानाः tormented, विबुधाः learned, दीप्स्सैः intense, तपोभिः austerities also, पितामहम् Brahma, अपूजयन् worshipped
translation: "Tormented by the oppression of Ravana, on account of the boon (given to him by the creator) and intensity of his austerities, the learned worshipped Brahma."

meaning: तुष्टः gratified, महात्मा great self, पितामहः Brahma, देवतानाम् to Devatas, हितार्थाय wishing good, सर्वाःall, देवताः Devatas, इदम् thus, महत् great, वचःwords, उवाच spoke
translation: "Gratified by the worship of Devatas, wishing them good, Brahma spoke these words."

meaning: अद्यप्रभृति from now, सर्वे all, दानवराक्षसाःDanavas and Rakshasas, नित्यम् every day, भयेन in fear, प्रावृताः range, शाश्वतम् permanently, त्रीन् three, लोकान् worlds, विचरिष्यन्ति will wander
translation: "From now ,all Danavas and Rakshasas will range the three worlds every day permanently in fear."

meaning: इन्द्रपुरोगमैः marching towards Indra, सर्वैः all, दैवतैः Devatas, समागम्य getting together, वृषध्वजः device of bull, त्रिपुरहा Tripura, महादेवः Lord MahaDeva, प्रसादितःpropitiated
translation: "Getting together all the Devatas marched towards Indra and propitiated Lord MahaDeva, destroyer of Tripura, who Bears the sign of bull on his abode."

meaning: प्रसन्नः pleased, महादेवः MahaDeva, देवान् Devatas, एतत् this, वचः words, अब्रवीत् spoke, वःfor, हितार्थम् their benefit, रक्षःक्षयावहा for destruction of Rakshasas, नारी woman, उत्पत्स्यति will be born
translation: MahaDeva was pleased by the Devatas and spoke these words for their benefit," a woman will be born for the destruction of Rakshasas."

meaning: पुरा earlier, क्षुत् hunger, दानवान् यथा Danavas also, देवैः Devatas, प्रयुक्ताः instigated, राक्षसघ्नी Rakshasas, एषासीता Sita, सरावणान् that Ravana, नः also, भक्षयिष्यति will consume
translation: "Just as hunger consumed Danavas earlier, this woman, instigated (by Devatas) will consume all Rakshasas and Ravana."

meaning: दुर्विनीतस्य misconduct, दुर्मतेः evil minded, रावणस्य Ravana's, अपनीतेन immoral action, शोकेन in grief, समभिप्लुतः attended by, घोरः terrific, अयम् us, निष्टानकः stares at us
translation: "Because of the misconduct of the evilminded Ravana's immoral action, terrific destruction attended by grief stares at us."

meaning: युगक्षये at the time of destruction of the world, कालेनtime spirit, उपसृष्टानाम् इव threatened like this, राघवेण by Raghava, नः not, लोके in this world, यःwho, शरणदः can protect, भवेत् us, तम् him, न पश्यामहे not able to perceive
translation: "Threatened like this by Raghava, we cannot perceive anyone in this world who can protect us now. Just as beings are threatened by the time spirit at the end of the destruction of this world, we are threatened."

meaning: वने in the forest, दावाग्निवेष्टितानाम् like wild fire, करेणूनांयथा like female elephants, महति huge, भये fear, तिष्ठताम् stays, नः none, शरणम् to protect, कश्चित् indeed, नास्ति not there
translation: "Indeed, there is no protection for us here to stay, as we are like the female elephants in the forest covered by huge wildfire."

meaning: महात्मना great self, तेनपौलस्त्येन by that Paulastya, प्राप्तकालम् opportune time having come, कृतम् did, यतः that which, एवम् in that way, भयम् fear, दृष्टम् perceiving, तमेव he also, शरणंगतः sought refuge
translation: "Great Vibheeshana of the Paulastya race, perceiving opportune time, has sought refuge out of fear."
